AD_LaezelReactsToAttack.synopsis: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat1.synopsis: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Nymessa plays this AD when the combat ends and while she returns to the cage, if Damays is dead (otherwise Damays is the one doing the AD).

AD_TieflingsLeaving.synopsis: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.synopsis: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.

AD_OpenCage1.synopsis: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).

AD_LaeZelDead.synopsis: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.synopsis: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.

AD_LaezelDeadSolo1.synopsis: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.

AD_OtherDied1.synopsis: Nymessa reacts to the death of Damayhs at Teifling scene

AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.synopsis: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|

TieflingsScene.synopsis: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).

LaezelDead.synopsis: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)

PickASide.synopsis: Occurs if the player tells the tieflings to lower Lae'zel and kill her, or if player lets the tieflings try to take her away. One last chance to choose a side.

AD_OtherDied2.synopsis: Damays reacts to the death of nymessa at Lae'zel recruitment.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.synopsis: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|

AD_OpenCageLaezel.synopsis: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.

TieflingsSceneFallback.synopsis: Edge-case: the normal dialog failed to start. Someone is silenced or wild shaped... Let's just do the midmeld and start combatYou come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).

AD_EscortStart.synopsis: Tieflings have shot down Lae'zel from her cage thinking the would tie her up and take her to the grove. They shoul dhave thought it through. Lae'zel is not going quietly.

AD_LaezelDeadSolo2.synopsis: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.

AD_LaezelCombatComment.synopsis: A random combat was dragged up to Lae'zel Recruitment (bandits, brains, etc.); Lae'zel is still in the cage. She says  this AD only once, after a player's turn.

AD_OpenCage2.synopsis: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.synopsis: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: By carefully reading each session’s synopsis we can identify chains in which one event leads to another. For instance, the tieflings’ introductory dialogue (AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro) sets up a decision point (PickASide) for what to do with Lae'zel; hence, the introduction must come before the decision. Similarly, if the player attacks Lae'zel while she is in the cage (AD_LaezelReactsToAttack), that reaction can either lead to the tieflings scene (TieflingsScene) or cause Lae'zel herself to call the player (AD_OpenCageLaezel) – meaning these occur after the player’s attack. Also, when the cage is interacted with via a tiefling‐prompted action (AD_OpenCage1 or its variant AD_OpenCage2) this is intended to lead to an escort sequence (AD_EscortStart). In addition, looking at the death and combat outcomes several sessions have variant dialogues that cannot both happen in one journey – for example, the two variants of tiefling reactions when one dies (AD_OtherDied1 versus AD_OtherDied2), the two variants when Lae’zel dies on her own (AD_LaezelDeadSolo1 versus AD_LaezelDeadSolo2), and likewise variants for the opening of the cage as well as for return versus leaving combat (AD_ReturnAnyCombat1 vs AD_ReturnAnyCombat2 and AD_LeavingAnyCombat1 vs AD_LeavingAnyCombat2). These groups are mutually exclusive in any given playthrough.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat1_0.speaker: Nymessa
AD_ReturnAnyCombat1_0.text: It's over and done with. I've got my eye on you, toad.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat1_1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_ReturnAnyCombat1_1.text: Back to the toad-freak. I can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving_0.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving_0.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses_0.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1_0.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1_0.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead_3.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead_3.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelDead_5.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel is defeated but not dead

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_4.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_4.text: Of course it's dangerous. One of them carved up Zorru's whole squad.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_0.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_0.text: And let the goblins have it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_7.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_7.text: No. We take it to the grove.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_1.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_1.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_3.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_3.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_5.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro_5.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat1_0.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LeavingAnyCombat1_0.text: I can't stay here. It's too dangerous.

TieflingsScene_156.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_156.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

TieflingsScene_268.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene_268.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene_46.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_46.text: Rather demanding for a woman in your position. Why should I?

TieflingsScene_26.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_26.text: Don't worry - I'll get him out of here, one way or another.

TieflingsScene_192.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_192.text: A githyanki. She ought to be killed, here and now.

TieflingsScene_214.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_214.text: This creature is dangerous. Get out of here - leave it to me!

TieflingsScene_119.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_119.text: You're right. I need to go check out that blast.

TieflingsScene_93.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_93.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

TieflingsScene_252.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_252.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

TieflingsScene_142.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_142.text: I'm in dire need of healing. Where is this camp?

TieflingsScene_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then nods his head.

TieflingsScene_104.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_104.text: And be careful. There are goblin traps everywhere.

TieflingsScene_178.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then shakes his head.

TieflingsScene_107.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_107.text: No. I'm not leaving this fiend with a stranger.

TieflingsScene_3.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_3.text: Shoot the trap down. We must kill it before it harms someone.

TieflingsScene_4.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_4.text: You're right. No one's safe if that thing goes loose.

TieflingsScene_203.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_203.text: Lower the trap and ready yourself.

TieflingsScene_126.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_126.text: No. I'm taking it to camp. Zevlor will know what to do with it.

TieflingsScene_87.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_87.text: Shoot the trap down. I'll tear it apart before anyone else gets hurt.

TieflingsScene_213.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_213.text: Oh, gods! You've caught a scout; the gith invasion force is right behind me - save yourself!

TieflingsScene_276.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_276.text: Hells, this isn't worth it. I'm out of here.

TieflingsScene_262.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_262.text: The githyanki's an intelligent creature, just like you. Release her, and let us converse civilly.

TieflingsScene_83.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_83.text: Converse with it? I barely know what it is!

TieflingsScene_23.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_23.text: Can't be that clever - walked right into our trap. I'm taking it back to camp - Zevlor will know what to do with it.

TieflingsScene_37.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_37.text: She's an intelligent creature, not a beast to be trapped. Cut her down, and converse with her.

TieflingsScene_44.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene_44.text: Your quarry looks dangerous, but I've handled worse. Leave it to me, get to safety.

TieflingsScene_173.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene_173.text: You again. Get rid of him.

TieflingsScene_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling lower their weapon and leaves.

TieflingsScene_106.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene_106.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsScene_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene_260.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene_260.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsScene_17.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene_17.text: *The captive's mouth is still, yet her voice is clear.*

TieflingsScene_159.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_159.text: Lower the trap, Nymessa. This creature must die.

TieflingsScene_195.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene_195.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.

TieflingsScene_21.speaker: Lae'zel

TieflingsScene_200.speaker: Shadowheart
TieflingsScene_200.text: Remember how keen she was to leave me to die on the nautiloid? We can't trust her.

TieflingsScene_72.speaker: Narrator

LaezelDead_13.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_13.text: North-west. Look for Nettie. Whatever your wound, she can mend it.

LaezelDead_31.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_31.text: And mind the goblin traps, unless you relish a spit-roasting.

LaezelDead_6.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_6.text: I'm sorry, but... we've enough mouths to feed.

LaezelDead_19.speaker: Nymessa
LaezelDead_19.text: What could make such a ruckus?

LaezelDead_26.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_26.text: Now come. We have a blast to investigate.

LaezelDead_8.speaker: Player
LaezelDead_8.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

LaezelDead_30.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_30.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so we came for a look.

LaezelDead_21.speaker: Player
LaezelDead_21.text: I'm in dire need of healing. Where is this camp?

LaezelDead_34.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_34.text: North-west. Look for Nettie. Whatever your wound, she can mend it.

LaezelDead_4.speaker: Nymessa
LaezelDead_4.text: And mind the goblin traps, unless you relish a spit-roasting.

LaezelDead_23.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead_23.text: Find refuge elsewhere. We've enough mouths to feed.

PickASide_0.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide_0.text: You've but one chance. Join me, or die.
PickASide_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player persuaded the tieflings that they should kill the creature

PickASide_8.speaker: Player
PickASide_8.text: This isn't my fight. I'm not picking sides.
PickASide_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Trying to remain neutral while the tiefling(s) want(s) to take Lae'zel away. Not available if the player explicitely persuaded the tieflings that Lae'zel must be killed

PickASide_16.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide_16.text: Prove you're not a craven. Join me, or die.
PickASide_16.context: InternalNodeContext: The player took their leave in the dialog, or perhaps they failed all the persuasions, so the tieflings are acting on their own and wants to bring Lae'zel to camp

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2_0.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2_0.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2_1.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2_1.text: We can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

TieflingsSceneFallback_5.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback_5.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsSceneFallback_7.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback_7.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsSceneFallback_0.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback_0.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsSceneFallback_1.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsSceneFallback_3.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsSceneFallback_8.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsSceneFallback_2.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsSceneFallback_6.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback_6.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsSceneFallback_9.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback_9.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

AD_EscortStart_3.speaker: Damays
AD_EscortStart_3.text: Hold it still - I'll tie it up.

AD_EscortStart_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_EscortStart_1.text: You expect a githyanki to surrender? Imbeciles.

AD_EscortStart_4.speaker: Nymessa
AD_EscortStart_4.text: Time to get this toad tied up.

AD_EscortStart_2.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_EscortStart_2.text: You expect a githyanki to surrender? Imbecile.

AD_LaezelCombatComment_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelCombatComment_0.text: Let me down, and I'll show you true might!

AD_LaezelCombatComment_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelCombatComment_1.text: Let me down, and we will prove our people's might!

AD_OpenCage2_0.speaker: Damays
AD_OpenCage2_0.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_0.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_0.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_1.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_1.text: Back to the toad-freak. I can't risk it escaping.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_2.text: It's over and done with. I've got my eye on you, toad.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_3.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2_3.text: Quick - back to the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.
